intro: Argyrolobium lunare subsp. sericeum, commonly known as the silver globular pea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage and spherical, globular seed pods. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
